definition: outstanding/particularly, especially/a fault/to express discontentment against
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Ulysses is not difficult to read, and it richly rewards each reader in wisdom and pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 尤利西斯》不難讀，它會給每位讀者以智慧和愉悅。

sentences.english: It's a whole version of Ulysses here.
sentences.chinese: 這裏印的是整版的尤利西斯。

sentences.english: I feel like Ulysses straining against the ropes, but they hold fast.
sentences.chinese: 而我像尤利西斯一樣被繩索緊緊縛住。

sentences.english: Pure diegesis and parody are two narrative modes employed in Ulysses.
sentences.chinese: 《尤利西斯》運用了本真和戲仿兩種敘述模式。

sentences.english: Maybe he brings news of our master, the lordly Vlysses.
sentences.chinese: 他也許帶來我們主人，威嚴的尤利西斯的消息。

sentences.english: Ulysses is no harder to understand than any other great classic.
sentences.chinese: 尤利西斯》本質上也還是一個故事。

definition: William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Orwell (name)/George Orwell (1903-1950), British novelist, author of Animal Farm 動物農場|动物农场 and 1984 一九八四年
James Joyce (1882-1941), Irish modernist writer, author of Ulysses and Finnegans Wake
pinyin: Zhan1 mu3 si1 · Qiao2 yi1 si1

definition: Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
Virgil or Vergilius (70-19 BC), Roman poet and author of the Aeneid 埃涅阿斯紀|埃涅阿斯纪[Ai1 nie4 a1 si1 Ji4]
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: Melville (name)/Herman Melville (1819-1891), US novelist, author of Moby Dick 白鯨|白鲸[bai2 jing1]
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Scott (name)/Sir Walter Scott (1771-1832), Scottish romantic novelist
